title: Pedestrian struck and killed in New Bedford, marking second fatal incident in two days
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The recent pedestrian deaths have prompted New Bedford police to begin an “enhanced” roadway safety initiative.
A recent string of pedestrian deaths in New Bedford has prompted law enforcement to take action.

John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo January 4, 2026 | 9:51 AM 1 minute to read A pedestrian was struck and killed Friday evening in New Bedford, prompting the city’s law enforcement to enact a new safety initiative.

title: Dartmouth teen facing homicide charge for fatal New Year’s hit-and-run in New Bedford
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The 16-year-old is suspected of fatally striking a New Bedford woman following a New Year’s church gathering.
Antonio Colaj, the victim's husband, speaks at a Jan.
3 gathering held in her honor.

title: Jaylen Brown torches Clippers for 50 points in Saturday night blowout
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown recorded a new season high and was one point shy of a career high.
Jaylen Brown rose above the Clippers' Kawhi Leonard and everyone else in Inglewood, Calif.
, on Saturday night, tying his career high with 50 points despite sitting out the final 3:44 of a blowout victory.

title: Examining Patriots’ playoff scenarios, possible Wild Card Round opponents entering Week 18
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots If the Patriots wind up playing in the Wild Card Round, there are three teams they could possibly face.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots will learn what their playoff path will look like after Sunday's game against the Dolphins.
(AP Photo/Vera Nieuwenhuis) By Conor Roche January 3, 2026 | 4:14 PM 7 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 4 things to know about the Dolphins before the Patriots play them on Sunday
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Dolphins enter Sunday's matchup at 7-9 and seem to be every bit the part of a team looking toward next season.
Mike McDaniel could be coaching his last game with the Dolphins onS udnay.

title: Jaylen Brown disagrees with NBA naming Jalen Brunson Player of the Month over him
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics "Neither one of them had a better month than I had.
" Jaylen Brown led the NBA in scoring for the month of December.

(AP Photo/Scott Marshall) By Conor Roche January 3, 2026 | 11:38 AM 3 minutes to read Jaylen Brown didn’t agree with the NBA’s decision to name Knicks guard Jalen Brunson the Eastern Conference Player of the Month for December, to say the least.

title: 26 good things about 2025 in the sports media scene
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Sports News National and local people, places, and things that were enjoyed or appreciated from the past year on the sports media beat.
Longtime Celtics sideline reporter Abby Chin is part of an NBC Sports Boston broadcast team with growing chemistry.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Chad Finn January 3, 2026 | 11:24 AM 4 minutes to read The calendars have been flipped for a few days now, but before we dive headlong into the 2026 sports media scene, your semiloyal scribe (that’s me) wanted to jot down a few national and local people, places, and things that I enjoyed or appreciated from the past year on this beat.

title: 3 arrested in child sex sting, including Framingham official
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News A Framingham Planning Board vice chair has stepped down following his arrest in a child sex sting operation.
A Framingham city official is one of three Massachusetts men to face charges in a child sex sting operation.
State police said the men allegedly thought they were arranging to pay for sex with an underage child.

title: Boston man charged after allegedly stealing more than $55K in merchandise from multiple Targets
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News A 54-year-old man was caught allegedly trying to make off with 27 bottles of lotion from the South Bay Plaza Target.
A Dorchester man was arrested Tuesday in connection with the alleged theft of more than $55,000 worth of merchandise from Target stores across the country, Boston police said.
Long Tran, 54, is charged with shoplifting by asportation of more than $250 and trespassing, according to police.

title: Victims of Central Mass. crash IDed as 19- and 20-year-old men
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The two young men, one from Gardner and the other from Winchendon, died in a crash the day after Christmas.
Authorities have identified the two people killed in an early-morning crash in Barre the day after Christmas as young men from Central Massachusetts.
Connor Post, 20, of Gardner, and Michael Publicover, 19, of Winchendon, died in the crash, which occurred around 4:25 a.
